titleStmt.title: A justification of the present war against the United Netherlands wherein the declaration of His Majesty is vindicated, and the war proved to be just, honourable and necessary, the dominion of the sea explained, and His Majesties rights thereunto asserted, the obligations of the Dutch to England, and their continual ingratitude : illustrated with sculptures : in answer to a Dutch treatise entituled, Considerations upon the present state of the United Netherlands / by an English man.
titleStmt.author: Stubbe, Henry, 1632-1676.

titleStmt.title: A justification of the present war against the United Netherlands wherein the declaration of His Majesty is vindicated, and the war proved to be just, honourable and necessary, the dominion of the sea explained, and His Majesties rights thereunto asserted, the obligations of the Dutch to England, and their continual ingratitude : illustrated with sculptures : in answer to a Dutch treatise entituled, Considerations upon the present state of the United Netherlands / by an English man.
titleStmt.author: Stubbe, Henry, 1632-1676.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Hills and John Starkey ...,

notesStmt.note: Written by Henry Stubbe. Cf. DNB.
Caption title: Impartial and seasonable reflections upon a late book entituled Considerations upon the present state of the United Netherlands.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
